rukus.text: Indeed, have succeeded the Believers
those: they are humble and submissive during their Salat
and those: they are those who keep (themselves) away from Al-Laghw
and those: they are implementors regarding Zakat
and those: they, regarding their private, sexual-parts are protectors —

except in relation to their marital partners or those whom their right hands held in trust (as milk-e-yameen marital partner under a document of state) — then surely they are outside those who are under blame (of committing anything undesirable)
and whoever sought (sex-satisfaction) beyond (or in addition to) this, then those: they are those who cross the limits
and those: they remain mindful regarding their trusts and their promise
and those: they over their Salats behave as guards (i.e., they strictly adhere to the ordainments regarding the canonical Prayers)
Those people — they are the inheritors
those who shall inherit Al-Firdaus (The Paradise). They will be dwellers therein
And surely, indeed We (initially) created the human being out of an extract of clay
Afterwards (to continue him in progeny and race) We made him a Nutfah in a safe depository (called the female womb or uterus)

Then We turned the Nutfah into a hanging mass, then We turned this hanging mass into a fleshy-lump, then We turned the fleshy-lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with muscle. Afterwards We brought it forth as a creation quite different (in the form of a fully differentiated living human baby). So Allah became Blessed — More Excellent of the creators
Then, surely you, after this, are indeed those who must die
Then surely, you will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection
And surely, indeed We have created above you seven (many) pathways (in space). And We are not unaware-ones of the creation
And We sent down from towards the sky (rain-) water according to assessment, then We caused it to stay inside the earth. And surely, We are indeed Capable Ones on its disappearance
Then We brought forth for you therewith (i.e., through the agency of water) gardens of date-palms, and grapes. For you therein are fruits — numerous, and thereof you eat
And a tree (of olives) that springs forth from Mount Sainaa/Mount of Olives (see 95/1), that grows laden with oil and coloured (fruits) for those who eat
And verily, in the cattle there is indeed a lesson for you. We make you to drink (milk) of that which is in their bellies. And there are for you, in them, benefits — numerous, and thereof you eat
And on them, and the on ship you are carried (from one place to another)
